poem:
Title: "Quiz of Quandaries"

On the shores of the river Nile, a likeness smiled, 
in the cradle of old Amarna.
Mechanical marvel among UK's isles, 
gears groan on a rotating panorama.
The Hill Sister's serenade, a ubiquity quilted,
exalts a fruit shaped by noble decay.
Canine heroes pale under northern light, 
under a hierarchy's humble fray.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "What links Bull Moose and Know Nothing? The Saturday quiz The questions 1 Whose likeness was found on 6 December 1912 in Tell el-Amarna, Egypt?2 Where in the UK is the world’s only rotating boat lift?3 Which ubiquitous tune was written by Mildred and Patty Hill?4 Which fruit is affected by noble rot?5 What race was won in 2024 by Dallas Seavey and 14 dogs?6 What is the lowest staff rank in the British army?7". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: What links Bull Moose and Know Nothing?
